questions.question_text: Which three AWS policy types and identities are used to calculate the net effective permissions? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABC
AWS IAM role
AWS IAM policy
AWS IAM group
AWS service control policies (SCPs)
Role trust relationships
Permission boundaries
NotAction
Policies with wild card support

questions.question_text:
Based on the following information, which RQL query will satisfy the requirement to identify VM hosts deployed to organization public cloud environments exposed to network traffic from the internet and affected by Text4Shell RCE (CVE-2022-42889) vulnerability?

• Network flow logs from all virtual private cloud (VPC) subnets are ingested to the Prisma Cloud Enterprise Edition tenant.
• All virtual machines (VMs) have Prisma Cloud Defender deployed.

choices.A: network from vpc.flow_record where bytes > 0 AND dest.resource IN (resource where finding.type IN ('Host Vulnerability') AND finding.source IN ('Prisma Cloud') AND finding.name IN ('CVE-2022-42889')) AND source.publicnetwork IN ('Internet IPs', 'Suspicious IPs')
choices.D: config from cloud.resource where cloud.type = 'aws' AND api.name = 'aws-ec2-describe-instances' AND json.rule = publicIpAddress exists AND finding.type IN ('Host Vulnerability') AND finding.source IN ('Prisma Cloud') AND finding.name IN ('CVE-2022-42889')
choices.C: network from vpc.flow_record where bytes > 0 AND finding.type IN ('Host Vulnerability') AND finding.source IN ('Prisma Cloud') AND finding.name IN ('CVE-2022-42889') AND source.publicnetwork = 'Internet IPs'
choices.B: config from vpc.flow_record where bytes > 0 AND dest.resource IN (resource where finding.type IN ('Host Vulnerability') AND finding.source IN ('Prisma Cloud') AND finding.name IN ('CVE-2022-42889')) AND source.publicnetwork = ('Internet IPs' or 'Suspicious IPs')

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Prisma Cloud enables you to send notifications for new code and CI/CD security issues detected during periodic scans of your environments to messaging systems that you have integrated with Prisma Cloud. Supported messaging systems include Microsoft Teams, Slack, Splunk, JIRA, ServiceNow notification systems, as well as for webhooks.

Selected Answer: D
Supported messaging systems include Microsoft Teams, Slack, Splunk, JIRA, ServiceNow notification systems, as well as for webhooks.
https://docs.prismacloud.io/en/classic/appsec-admin-guide/get-started/finetune-configuration-settings/enable-notifications

questions.question_text: Which of the following is not a supported external integration for receiving Prisma Cloud Code Security notifications?
Which type of RQL query should be run to determine if AWS Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) instances without encryption was enabled?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
List non-encrypted sda1 and xvda volumes.
https://docs.prismacloud.io/en/classic/rql-reference/rql-reference/rql-examples

choices.B: event from cloud.security_logs where operation IN ( 'ChangePassword', 'ConsoleLogin', 'DeactivateMFADevice', 'DeleteAccessKey' , 'DeleteAlarms' ) AND user = 'root'
choices.D: event from cloud.audit_logs where Risk.Level = 'high' AND user = 'root'
choices.A: event from cloud.audit_logs where operation IN ( 'ChangePassword', 'ConsoleLogin', 'DeactivateMFADevice', 'DeleteAccessKey' , 'DeleteAlarms' ) AND user = 'root'
choices.C: config from cloud.audit_logs where operation IN ( 'ChangePassword', 'ConsoleLogin', 'DeactivateMFADevice', 'DeleteAccessKey', 'DeleteAlarms' ) AND user = 'root'

questions.question_text: Which RQL query is used to detect certain high-risk activities executed by a root user in AWS?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Detect risky changes executed by a root user.
https://docs.prismacloud.io/en/classic/rql-reference/rql-reference/event-query/event-query-examples
